revealed_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.
revealed_symptoms.evolving: This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before.
revealed_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
revealed_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
revealed_symptoms.nodule formation: It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles.
revealed_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
revealed_symptoms.satellite lesions: There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.

hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
hidden_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
hidden_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, I've got this thing on my skin that's worrying me. It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away. Also, this thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. And there's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. Also, there are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.

Thank you for providing that information. I understand you have a skin lesion that is concerning. Can you tell me where this lesion is located on your body? Also, how long have you had this spot on your skin?
It's on my back, near my shoulder. I've probably had it for a few months, but I only really started paying attention to it recently because of all the changes.
Thank you. That helps. Have you had a lot of sun exposure over your lifetime? Things like tanning beds or outdoor work or hobbies?
Yeah, I've worked outside a lot over the years. I'm a landscaper, so I'm out in the sun pretty much all day, every day.
Thank you. The prolonged sun exposure does increase the risk of skin cancer. Do you have any family history of skin cancer?
Not that I know of. No one in my family has ever mentioned anything like that.

Thank you. Could you describe the color of the lesion? Is it a uniform color, or does it have multiple colors or shades? Also, are the borders of the spot well-defined and regular, or are they blurred or jagged?
It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in. And the edges… well, they're not very neat. They're kind of blurred and not a nice, clean circle.

Thank you. The description of the lesion is concerning for melanoma. How big is this spot? Can you give me an estimate in centimeters or inches, like the size of a pencil eraser, a dime, or something else?
It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.

Also, this thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. And there's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. Also, there are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
